snippet: With physical and virtual visits “off the charts,” libraries across the country are thinking up innovative ways to keep users happy.
abstract: Boston Public Library, which was founded in 1848 and is the oldest public urban library in the country, is moving rapidly to becoming a bustling community center where talking out loud and even eating are perfectly acceptable; with a major renovation underway, institution is breaking out of its granite shell to show an airier, more welcoming side to the passing multitudes; libraries around nation are following same philosophy.
lead_paragraph: With physical and virtual visits “off the charts,” libraries across the country are thinking up innovative ways to keep users happy.

headline.main: Breaking Out of the Library Mold, in Boston and Beyond
headline.print_headline: Breaking Out of the Library Mold
